item.title: I-15 North - Exit 67
item.description: I-15 north at Exit 67 - BL-15/US-30/US-91/5th Ave. US-91 and US-30 leave I-15 northbound. This is the southern end of the Pocatello business loop.

item.title: I-15 North - Pocatello City Limit
item.description: Entering Pocatello on I-15 north. Pocatello is the 6rd largest city in Idaho according to the 2020 Census.

item.description: I-15 north at Exit 47 - US-30 East/Lava Hot Springs/Soda Springs/Montpelier. US-30 west joins I-15 and US-91 north to Pocatello.

item.description: US-91 north approaching I-15. I-15/US-91 north to Arimo and Pocatello. Continue over overpass for I-15 South to Salt Lake (Utah) and Hawkins Road. US-91 north joins I-15 north to Pocatello.

item.description: US-91 north at ID-40 west to Malad. Continue north on US-91 for Arimo and Pocatello.

item.description: US-91 North approaching ID-40 West. Continue north on US-91 for I-15 North; use ID-40 west for I-15 south.

item.title: US-91 North at Oxford Highway
item.description: US-91 North at Oxford Highway in Bannock County. The intersection is located at Red Rock Pass which was the site of an ancient dam on prehistoric Lake Bonneville. The erosion of this dam created the catastrophic Bonneville Floods which affected much of the Snake River plain of Idaho.

item.title: US-91 South - To I-15/I-84
item.description: US-91 South - To I-15/I-84 in Brigham City. US-91 is posted as US-91 west, which is the current direction of the roadway, although the route itself is a north-south route.

item.title: US-91 - Red Rock Pass Historical Marker
item.description: Historical Marker on Red Rock Pass, US-91 South. All highways in Idaho have these historical markers. To see all of them check out the Idaho State Historical Marker Guide. Red Rock Pass is where ancient Lake Bonneville - an inland sea, which covered most of the great basin, overflowed into the Snake Plain. Evidence of this great flood is everywhere along the Snake and Columbia Rivers in the Pacific Northwest. This pass marks the divide between the Great Basin and the Snake/Columbia River drainages.

item.title: US-91 South - Cache County
item.description: Cache County, on US-91 South. This is taken at the Idaho/Utah line. Cache County is the first marker on the state line. If you look in the background of the photo you can see the official welcome sign.

item.title: US-91 South - Welcome To Utah
item.description: Welcome To Utah on US-91 South. This was taken before the Salt Lake Olympics. Currently, Utah still uses the same style of Welcome Sign.
